intro: Rochelia plurisepalea, commonly known as the many-sepal rochelia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers with numerous sepals that resemble petals. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
